events.originalText: A child suicide bomber attacked a wedding in Nadahan, Afghanistan, killing at least 40 people and injuring at least 70 others.
events.subtitle: Nadahan wedding bombing
events.headline: Child suicide bomber kills 40 at wedding in Nadahan, Afghanistan

events.originalText: The Kumanovo Agreement was signed, bringing an end to the Kosovo War the next day.
events.subtitle: Kumanovo Agreement
events.headline: Kumanovo Agreement signed, ending Kosovo War

events.originalText: Lebanon War: The Israeli Air Force carried out Operation Mole Cricket 19, successfully suppressing Syrian air defenses in the Beqaa Valley, Lebanon.
events.subtitle: 1982 Lebanon War
events.headline: Israeli Air Force suppresses Syrian air defenses in Lebanon

events.originalText: The racehorse Secretariat, of Meadow Stables (racing colors pictured), won the Belmont Stakes by 31 lengths, achieving the first American Triple Crown victory in a quarter of a century.
events.subtitle: Secretariat (horse)
events.headline: Secretariat wins Belmont Stakes by 31 lengths

events.originalText: Fighting began between the Viet Cong and the Army of the Republic of Vietnam in the Battle of Đồng Xoài, one of the largest battles in the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: Viet Cong
events.headline: Viet Cong battles Army of the Republic of Vietnam in Battle of Đồng Xoài

events.originalText: During the hearings investigating conflicting accusations between the United States Army and Senator Joseph McCarthy, Army lawyer Joseph N. Welch asked McCarthy, "At long last, have you left no sense of decency?"
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: Joseph Welch questions McCarthy's decency in Army hearings

events.originalText: World War II: In reprisal for successful French Resistance attacks, the SS and SD hanged 99 men in the town of Tulle.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: SS and SD hang 99 men in Tulle in WWII reprisal

events.originalText: Australian aviator Charles Kingsford Smith and his crew landed the Southern Cross in Brisbane, completing the first transpacific flight.
events.subtitle: Charles Kingsford Smith
events.headline: Charles Kingsford Smith completes first transpacific flight

events.originalText: Unhappy with U.S. president Woodrow Wilson's handling of the RMS Lusitania sinking, William Jennings Bryan resigned as Secretary of State.
events.subtitle: Woodrow Wilson
events.headline: William Jennings Bryan resigns over Lusitania sinking

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union and Confederate forces fought the Battle of Brandy Station, the largest cavalry engagement to take place on American soil.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union and Confederate forces clash in Battle of Brandy Station

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate General Stonewall Jackson concluded his successful Shenandoah Valley campaign with a victory in the Battle of Port Republic.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Stonewall Jackson victorious in Battle of Port Republic

events.originalText: The first company of Mormon handcart pioneers left Iowa City for Salt Lake City, Utah.
events.subtitle: Mormon handcart pioneers
events.headline: Mormon handcart pioneers depart for Salt Lake City

events.originalText: In an act of defiance against the Navigation Acts, American colonists led by Abraham Whipple attacked and burned the British schooner Gaspee (depicted).
events.subtitle: Navigation Acts
events.headline: American colonists burn British schooner Gaspee in defiance

events.originalText: The first Book of Common Prayer is legally mandated, introducing a fully vernacular Protestant liturgy to the Church of England.
events.subtitle: Book of Common Prayer (1549)
events.headline: First Book of Common Prayer mandated in Church of England

events.originalText: Parisian printer Simon de Colines was fined for printing biblical commentary by Jacques Lefèvre d'Étaples without obtaining prior approval from theologians.
events.subtitle: Simon de Colines
events.headline: Parisian printer fined for unauthorized biblical commentary

events.originalText: Abu Muslim initiated an open revolt against Umayyad rule, eventually leading to the establishment of the Abbasid Caliphate under the Black Standard.
events.subtitle: AD 747
events.headline: Abu Muslim revolts against Umayyad rule, establishes Abbasid Caliphate
